verses.roman:
rāṅgā-yaṣṭi haste dole yena matta siṁha
cāri-pāśe veḍi āche caraṇete bhṛṅga

synonyms: rāṅgā-yaṣṭi—a red stick; haste—in the hand; dole—moves; yena—like; matta—mad; siṁha—lion; cāri-pāśe—all around; veḍi—surrounding; āche—there is; caraṇete—at the lotus feet; bhṛṅga—bumblebees.
translation: His red stick moving in His hand, He seemed like a maddened lion. All around the four sides of His feet were bumblebees.
